p: Global climate is changing rapidly because of anthropogenic greenhouse gas emissions, with unexpected consequences ( Solomon, 2007). For example, Solomon (2007) predicted that, if nothing is done to limit the production of greenhouse gases, the average temperature on the earth’s surface is projected to rise by 1.1–6.4 °C between 1990 and 2100. Climate change can alter the distribution of organisms by causing shifts in area, latitude, longitude and/or altitude and thus impact their geographic ranges ( Pearson & Dawson, 2003; Raxworthy et al., 2008). Range changes can impact ecosystem function and biodiversity ( Raxworthy et al., 2008).
